articles.title: OpenAI gets caught vibe graphing
articles.description: During its big GPT-5 livestream on Thursday, OpenAI showed off a few charts that made the model seem quite impressive — but if you look closely, some graphs were a little bit off. In one, ironically showing how well GPT-5 does in “deception evals across models,” the scale is all over the place. For “coding […]
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: The Browser Company’s AI browser now has a $20 subscription
articles.description: The Browser Company — the makers of the Arc browser — just launched a $20 per month subscription to its new AI-powered web browser, Dia, as reported earlier by TechCrunch. The new Dia Pro subscription comes with unlimited access to the browser’s chat feature, which lets you ask questions about the content in your tabs. […]
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: The latest iPad Air is cheaper than ever
articles.description: Laptops are great, but sometimes it’s simply just more convenient to use a tablet like the iPad Air. The Air’s easier to carry, after all, and still powerful enough to handle everything from streaming to taking notes and reading. And right now, the latest version of the Air is down to a new low price. […]
articles.author: Sheena Vasani

articles.title: The 6 biggest changes coming to ChatGPT
articles.description: GPT-5 has finally arrived. Along with the announcement of the highly anticipated AI model, OpenAI also previewed several updates coming to ChatGPT, ranging from visual changes to improvements to the chatbot’s performance. Here’s a rundown of all of the changes you can expect to see in ChatGPT. Say goodbye to the model picker With the […]
articles.author: Emma Roth

articles.title: Friendslop is coming for the Switch 2
articles.description: During today's Nintendo Indie World showcase, I had two epiphanies. The first was the realization that friendslop games are about to hit the Switch 2 like a falling piano in a Road Runner cartoon. The second was that I love that for me, because that means I can finally play them. My friends love "friendslop," […]
articles.author: Ash Parrish

articles.title: Paramount is now a Skydance Corporation
articles.description: It's official: Skydance Media's deal to purchase CBS parent company Paramount Global for $8 billion is complete, and incoming chairman / CEO David Ellison's first order of business is a massive restructuring. In an open letter about his plans for Paramount, a Skydance Corporation (the merged companies' new name), Ellison announced that, going forward, the […]
articles.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

articles.title: Samsung’s inexpensive Galaxy Buds FE are even more affordable at over 50 percent off
articles.description: Samsung’s latest Unpacked event came and went with no major announcements related to the company’s Galaxy Buds lineup. However, if you don’t want to wait for what’s next, you can currently save on the Samsung Galaxy Buds FE, which are down to $46.99 ($53 off) at Woot. That’s their best price yet and a deal […]
articles.author: Brandon Russell

articles.title: Meta's prototype headsets show off the future of mixed reality
articles.description: Meta’s consumer VR headsets are already among the best you can get for their price points, but at a conference next week, the company is showing off some impressive-sounding research prototypes that could be a peek at what its headsets might be capable of in the future.  One headset, called “Tiramisu,” brings a “new milestone […]
articles.author: Jay Peters

articles.title: Weapons turns our deepest anxieties into a potent horror masterpiece
articles.description: Zach Cregger's first major film Barbarian was tense and frightening, but it was also infused with a healthy dose of absurdity. The movie's twisted sense of humor made it easier to stomach its grotesque violence and a bit more difficult to anticipate how its unhinged story would unfold. But Barbarian also worked surprisingly well as […]
articles.author: Charles Pulliam-Moore

articles.title: The best earbuds we’ve tested for 2025
articles.description: It’s hard to buy a bad pair of wireless earbuds these days, and with constant discounts and deals wherever you look, now is as good a time as any to splurge on the pair you’ve been eyeing. The market has come a long way since the early era of true wireless earbuds when we had […]
articles.author: Chris Welch
